intro: Beauverdia uniflora f. tenuitepala, commonly known as the slender-leaved beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in cooler, high-altitude environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
